org.jamesframework.core.problems.constraints.validations

Interface PenalizingValidation

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Validation
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimplePenalizingValidation

    public interface PenalizingValidation
extends Validation

    Interface of a validation produced by a penalizing constraint. Extends the main Validation interface with an additional method getPenalty() to access the assigned penalty. A predefined simple implementation is provided that wraps a boolean and double value reflecting whether the solution passed validation and the assigned penalty (see SimplePenalizingValidation).

    When implementing custom delta validations, the validation of the current solution of a neighbourhood search is passed back to the problem to validate a move. Knowing only whether the current solution passed validation and which penalty had been assigned might not be sufficient to efficiently validate the modified solution. In such case, custom penalizing validation objects can be designed that keep track of any additional metadata used for efficient delta validation.

    Author:
    Herman De Beukelaer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getPenalty()
      Get the assigned penalty.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.jamesframework.core.problems.constraints.validations.Validation

        passed

    • Method Detail

      • getPenalty

        double getPenalty()
        Get the assigned penalty. Should return 0 if the corresponding solution is valid, i.e. if Validation.passed() returns true, and a positive double value if the solution did not pass validation.
        Returns:
        assigned penalty
